Text:
W-Welcome. Thank you for coming. S-S-Such fine
weather we're having today—
Wetter?
...Skip the pleasantries. Just give us the details...
R-Right!

Face-to-face with two of the Shadow Garden's top
members, the pop-up store branch manager struggles to
maintain her composure—her knees tremble nervously.

U-Um, I see you've already changed into your
costumes. Lady Delta, Lady Eta, we'd like for
you to go out into the city dressed like that.
I'm an super-smart witch!
...I'm a fluttery vampire...

The costumes suit both of you very well. Please try to
enjoy the Halloween festivities... I do apologize for
burdening you with such work. I feel terrible.

...Tell you what. I feel terrible about making you
feel terrible... We'll just leave...
No!

If we go back without doing anything, Lady Alpha will
be...really mad at us!
...Just thought I'd give it a try.

...We'll complete our mission properly. Tell us the
details...
Understood.

During the Halloween event, we'll be handing out
ribbons exclusively to children who have made
purchases at Mitsugoshi-affiliated stores.
Ribbons?

These ribbons come in three colors: red, blue, and
yellow, with each corresponding to the amount spent.
We would like you to give sweets to the children
based on the color of their ribbons.

When children approach, they will say, "Trick or
treat!" If a child's ribbon is red, please offer them
both cookies and candy; for blue ribbons, just
cookies; and for yellow ribbons, just candy.
Okay got it. Is that all?

Y-Yes... Once again, I'm terribly sorry, but can I
leave these tasks to you?
No problem! Leave it to me! I'll handle it just fine!

...Giving out different sweets based on the amount
spent? Trust Gamma to come up with such a messy
system...
Messy? I prefer a mess of cookies AND candy!
...Yeah, that's not quite what I meant.
Well, anyway, it'll be more of a mess to explain...
Alright, Eta! Off to the frontlines!
...What the heck?
It's something Boss man said before!
Hmm...

Watching the enthusiastic Delta exit the room, with
the somewhat reluctant Eta in tow, the branch manager
finally breathes a sigh of relief.

Delta and Eta venture out into the city carrying
baskets filled with sweets. There they immediately
find themselves surrounded by a throng of excited
children—
Trick or treat! Give me sweets, witch lady!
Trick or treat! Me too! Gimme!
Hm?

Trick or treat! Hey, vampire lady! I've gotta red
ribbon!
Mine's blue... Oh, I forgot! Trick or treat!
Red. Got it. Blue. Here you go.
Hurry up, witch lady!
Umm... Red is this and this?
Hmm? And this one too?
Mine's yellow!
Yellow...is this and this? Oh, and this one!

Perhaps due to Eta's leisurely pace, most of the
children flock to Delta.
...Oh well.
U-Um... Trick or treat...
...A yellow ribbon. Candy... Here you go.
Th-Thanks! Bye, miss!
Bye...
Eta! What's taking you so long?
Heehee! I'm already out of sweets.
...Already?
I'll help you with yours, Eta!
...Sure. Thanks.
Leave it to me!

Eta hands her basket over to Delta. In no time at
all, the mountain of sweets rapidly vanishes.
Hee-hee-heeee! Finished!

Mission accomplished! Let's go report to that girl
from earlier! Hurry up, Eta!
Okay, okay...

Similar to when they entered the city, Eta quietly
follows behind Delta as she enthusiastically walks
ahead...
